nodes.bodyText: Could you keep isSpecificCompatibility as deprecated and it returns isSplitShuntAdmittanceXfmr2?
Could you keep setSpecificCompatibility as deprecated and it calls setSplitShuntAdmittanceXfmr2(specificCompatibility)?
Maybe keep this case to be able to read old JSON file for configuration?
Is this a good name? Is it only for two windings transformer? Isn't splitShuntAdmittance explicit enough? or maybe t2wtSplitShuntAdmittance? What do you think @annetill?

Are you sure this is the proper way to implement that. We should base the compatibility assessment on the version (which is just keep for now, but has been added specially for this kind of modification).

@mathbagu I am okay with your suggestion, it is indeed a cleaner way to handle compatibility. Just to be clear, it means that powsybl will be able to read previous versions but will always serialize JSON configuration files in the latest version, right?

ok Miora. I will do what you propose, I mean, compatibility will be based on the attribute version of the LoadFlowParameters class. The new code will be able to read serializations recorded with previous versions (recorded with the tag specificCompatibility and version 1.0) and will always serialize new JSON configuration files in the new version using the tag t2wtSplitShuntAdmittance and version 1.1.
The next planned PR extends splitShuntAdmittance to the threWindingsTransformers. We prefer to use a specific configuration attribute for twoWindingsTransformers (t2wtSplitShuntAdmittance) and for threeWindingsTransformers (t3wtSplitShuntAdmittance). My initial idea was two separated PRs, but now I am reconsidering the possibility to include all changes in this PR (PR1198) to avoid increasing the version twice. What do you prefer?

Even if another configuration attribute is added in another PR, it can still be in version 1.1: we only increase version if a new version has been delivered in a release so you can keep two separate PRs. Next release will be in a bit more than a month, so there should be no need to increase the version for the other PR if it is merged in this timeframe.
Done. The migration guide has also been updated.
The version should also be updated

nodes.bodyText: Additional names are here only to keep compatibility with deprecated parameters' names. Instead of iidm.export.ampl.t2wtSplitShuntAdmittance which had never been used as parameter before, you can put iidm.export.ampl.specific-compatibility and iidm.export.ampl.specificCompatibility.

Done. I Kept  iidm.export.ampl.t2wtSplitShuntAdmittance as additional name allowing to write the parameter with dashes or in camelCase (as in EXPORT_RATIOTAPCHANGER_VT) . Please confirm if i should delete it.
Rather than putting these methods here, put them in JsonUtil, they could be used in other versioned JSON serializers/deserializers.
Rather than doing that, you could simply call Objects.requireNonNull(version).
Is  only a typo? You should probably rewrite the message as: LoadflowParameters. Tag: %s is not a valid for property for LoadflowParameters version %s. LoadFlowParameters version should be > %s %n

The error message are too specific. Make these functions more generic (pass the message as a supplier) or pass every parameters needed to format the message (the context (LoadFlowParameters) should be pass as well).
